55 /**
56 bit-block array wrapped into union for correct interpretation of
57 32-bit vs 64-bit access vs SIMD
58 @internal
59 */
60 struct bit_block_t
61 {
62 union bunion_t
63 {
64 bm::word_t BM_VECT_ALIGN w32[bm::set_block_size] BM_VECT_ALIGN_ATTR;
65 bm::id64_t BM_VECT_ALIGN w64[bm::set_block_size / 2] BM_VECT_ALIGN_ATTR;
66
67#if defined(BMAVX512OPT)
68 __m512i BM_VECT_ALIGN w512[bm::set_block_size / 16] BM_VECT_ALIGN_ATTR;
69#endif
70#if defined(BMAVX2OPT)
71 __m256i BM_VECT_ALIGN w256[bm::set_block_size / 8] BM_VECT_ALIGN_ATTR;
72#endif
73#if defined(BMSSE2OPT) || defined(BMSSE42OPT)
74 __m128i BM_VECT_ALIGN w128[bm::set_block_size / 4] BM_VECT_ALIGN_ATTR;
75#endif
76 } b_;
77
78 operator bm::word_t*() { return &(b_.w32[0]); }
79 operator const bm::word_t*() const { return &(b_.w32[0]); }
80 explicit operator bm::id64_t*() { return &b_.w64[0]; }
81 explicit operator const bm::id64_t*() const { return &b_.w64[0]; }
82#ifdef BMAVX512OPT
83 explicit operator __m512i*() { return &b_.w512[0]; }
84 explicit operator const __m512i*() const { return &b_.w512[0]; }
85#endif
86#ifdef BMAVX2OPT
87 explicit operator __m256i*() { return &b_.w256[0]; }
88 explicit operator const __m256i*() const { return &b_.w256[0]; }
89#endif
90#if defined(BMSSE2OPT) || defined(BMSSE42OPT)
91 explicit operator __m128i*() { return &b_.w128[0]; }
92 explicit operator const __m128i*() const { return &b_.w128[0]; }
93#endif
94
95 const bm::word_t* begin() const { return (b_.w32 + 0); }
96 bm::word_t* begin() { return (b_.w32 + 0); }
97 const bm::word_t* end() const { return (b_.w32 + bm::set_block_size); }
98 bm::word_t* end() { return (b_.w32 + bm::set_block_size); }
99 };
100
101/**
102 Get minimum of 2 values
103*/
104template<typename T>
105BMFORCEINLINE T min_value(T v1, T v2) BMNOEXCEPT
106{
107 return v1 < v2 ? v1 : v2;
108}
109
110/**
111 \brief ad-hoc conditional expressions
112 \internal
113*/
114template <bool b> struct conditional
115{
116 static bool test() { return true; }
117};
118template <> struct conditional<false>
119{
120 static bool test() { return false; }
121};
122
123
124/**
125 Fast loop-less function to find LOG2
126*/
127template<typename T>
128BMFORCEINLINE T ilog2(T x) BMNOEXCEPT
129{
130 unsigned int l = 0;
131
132 if (x >= 1<<16) { x = (T)(x >> 16); l |= 16; }
133 if (x >= 1<<8) { x = (T)(x >> 8); l |= 8; }
134 if (x >= 1<<4) { x = (T)(x >> 4); l |= 4; }
135 if (x >= 1<<2) { x = (T)(x >> 2); l |= 2; }
136 if (x >= 1<<1) l |=1;
137 return (T)l;
138}
139
140template<>
141BMFORCEINLINE
142bm::gap_word_t ilog2(gap_word_t x) BMNOEXCEPT
143{
144 unsigned int l = 0;
145 if (x >= 1<<8) { x = (bm::gap_word_t)(x >> 8); l |= 8; }
146 if (x >= 1<<4) { x = (bm::gap_word_t)(x >> 4); l |= 4; }
147 if (x >= 1<<2) { x = (bm::gap_word_t)(x >> 2); l |= 2; }
148 if (x >= 1<<1) l |=1;
149 return (bm::gap_word_t)l;
150}
151
152/**
153 Mini auto-pointer for internal memory management
154 @internal
155*/
156template<class T>
157class ptr_guard
158{
159public:
160 ptr_guard(T* p) BMNOEXCEPT : ptr_(p) {}
161 ~ptr_guard() { delete ptr_; }
162private:
163 ptr_guard(const ptr_guard<T>& p);
164 ptr_guard& operator=(const ptr_guard<T>& p);
165private:
166 T* ptr_;
167};
168
169/**
170 Portable LZCNT with (uses minimal LUT)
171 @ingroup bitfunc
172 @internal
173*/
174BMFORCEINLINE
175unsigned count_leading_zeros(unsigned x) BMNOEXCEPT
176{
177 unsigned n =
178 (x >= (1U << 16)) ?
179 ((x >= (1U << 24)) ? ((x >= (1 << 28)) ? 28u : 24u) : ((x >= (1U << 20)) ? 20u : 16u))
180 :
181 ((x >= (1U << 8)) ? ((x >= (1U << 12)) ? 12u : 8u) : ((x >= (1U << 4)) ? 4u : 0u));
182 return unsigned(bm::lzcnt_table<true>::_lut[x >> n]) - n;
183}
184
185/**
186 Portable TZCNT with (uses 37-LUT)
187 @ingroup bitfunc
188 @internal
189*/
190BMFORCEINLINE
191unsigned count_trailing_zeros(unsigned v) BMNOEXCEPT
192{
193 // (v & -v) isolates the last set bit
194 return unsigned(bm::tzcnt_table<true>::_lut[(-v & v) % 37]);
195}
196
197/**
198 Lookup table based integer LOG2
199*/
200template<typename T>
201BMFORCEINLINE T ilog2_LUT(T x) BMNOEXCEPT
202{
203 unsigned l = 0;
204 if (x & 0xffff0000)
205 {
206 l += 16; x >>= 16;
207 }
208
209 if (x & 0xff00)
210 {
211 l += 8; x >>= 8;
212 }
213 return l + T(bm::first_bit_table<true>::_idx[x]);
214}
215
216/**
217 Lookup table based short integer LOG2
218*/
219template<>
220BMFORCEINLINE bm::gap_word_t ilog2_LUT<bm::gap_word_t>(bm::gap_word_t x) BMNOEXCEPT
221{
222 if (x & 0xff00)
223 {
224 x = bm::gap_word_t(x >> 8u);
225 return bm::gap_word_t(8u + bm::first_bit_table<true>::_idx[x]);
226 }
227 return bm::gap_word_t(bm::first_bit_table<true>::_idx[x]);
228}

231// if we are running on x86 CPU we can use inline ASM
232
233#if defined(BM_x86) && !(defined(__arm__) || defined(__aarch64__))
234#ifdef __GNUG__
235
236BMFORCEINLINE
237unsigned bsf_asm32(unsigned int v) BMNOEXCEPT
238{
239 unsigned r;
240 asm volatile(" bsfl %1, %0": "=r"(r): "rm"(v) );
241 return r;
242}
243
244BMFORCEINLINE
245unsigned bsr_asm32(unsigned int v) BMNOEXCEPT
246{
247 unsigned r;
248 asm volatile(" bsrl %1, %0": "=r"(r): "rm"(v) );
249 return r;
250}
251
252#endif // __GNUG__
253
254#ifdef _MSC_VER
255
256#if defined(_M_AMD64) || defined(_M_X64) // inline assembly not supported
257
258BMFORCEINLINE
259unsigned int bsr_asm32(unsigned int value) BMNOEXCEPT
260{
261 unsigned long r;
262 _BitScanReverse(&r, value);
263 return r;
264}
265
266BMFORCEINLINE
267unsigned int bsf_asm32(unsigned int value) BMNOEXCEPT
268{
269 unsigned long r;
270 _BitScanForward(&r, value);
271 return r;
272}
273
274#else
275
276BMFORCEINLINE
277unsigned int bsr_asm32(unsigned int value) BMNOEXCEPT
278{
279 __asm bsr eax, value
280}
281
282BMFORCEINLINE
283unsigned int bsf_asm32(unsigned int value) BMNOEXCEPT
284{
285 __asm bsf eax, value
286}
287
288#endif
289
290#endif // _MSC_VER
291
292#endif // BM_x86

294
295// From:
296// http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/summary?doi=10.1.1.37.8562
297//
298template<typename T>
299BMFORCEINLINE T bit_scan_fwd(T v) BMNOEXCEPT
300{
301 return
302 DeBruijn_bit_position<true>::_multiply[(((v & -v) * 0x077CB531U)) >> 27];
303}
304
305BMFORCEINLINE
306unsigned bit_scan_reverse32(unsigned w) BMNOEXCEPT
307{
308 BM_ASSERT(w);
309#if defined(BM_USE_GCC_BUILD) || (defined(__GNUG__) && (defined(__arm__) || defined(__aarch64__)))
310 return (unsigned) (31 - __builtin_clz(w));
311#else
312# if defined(BM_x86) && (defined(__GNUG__) || defined(_MSC_VER))
313 return bm::bsr_asm32(w);
314# else
315 return bm::ilog2_LUT<unsigned int>(w);
316# endif
317#endif
318}
319
320BMFORCEINLINE
321unsigned bit_scan_forward32(unsigned w) BMNOEXCEPT
322{
323 BM_ASSERT(w);
324#if defined(BM_USE_GCC_BUILD) || (defined(__GNUG__) && (defined(__arm__) || defined(__aarch64__)))
325 return (unsigned) __builtin_ctz(w);
326#else
327# if defined(BM_x86) && (defined(__GNUG__) || defined(_MSC_VER))
328 return bm::bsf_asm32(w);
329# else
330 return bit_scan_fwd(w);
331# endif
332#endif
333}
334
335
336BMFORCEINLINE
337unsigned long long bmi_bslr_u64(unsigned long long w) BMNOEXCEPT
338{
339#if defined(BMAVX2OPT) || defined (BMAVX512OPT)
340 return _blsr_u64(w);
341#else
342 return w & (w - 1);
343#endif
344}
345
346BMFORCEINLINE
347unsigned long long bmi_blsi_u64(unsigned long long w)
348{
349#if defined(BMAVX2OPT) || defined (BMAVX512OPT)
350 return _blsi_u64(w);
351#else
352 return w & (-w);
353#endif
354}
355
356/// 32-bit bit-scan reverse
357inline
358unsigned count_leading_zeros_u32(unsigned w) BMNOEXCEPT
359{
360 BM_ASSERT(w);
361#if defined(BMAVX2OPT) || defined (BMAVX512OPT)
362 return (unsigned)_lzcnt_u32(w);
363#else
364 #if defined(BM_USE_GCC_BUILD) || defined(__GNUG__)
365 return (unsigned) __builtin_clz(w);
366 #else
367 return bm::count_leading_zeros(w); // portable
368 #endif
369#endif
370}
371
372
373/// 64-bit bit-scan reverse
374inline
375unsigned count_leading_zeros_u64(bm::id64_t w) BMNOEXCEPT
376{
377 BM_ASSERT(w);
378#if defined(BMAVX2OPT) || defined (BMAVX512OPT)
379 return (unsigned)_lzcnt_u64(w);
380#else
381 #if defined(BM_USE_GCC_BUILD) || (defined(__GNUG__) && (defined(__arm__) || defined(__aarch64__)))
382 return (unsigned) __builtin_clzll(w);
383 #else
384 unsigned z;
385 unsigned w1 = unsigned(w >> 32);
386 if (!w1)
387 {
388 z = 32;
389 w1 = unsigned(w);
390 z += 31 - bm::bit_scan_reverse32(w1);
391 }
392 else
393 {
394 z = 31 - bm::bit_scan_reverse32(w1);
395 }
396 return z;
397 #endif
398#endif
399}
400
401/// 32-bit bit-scan fwd
402inline
403unsigned count_trailing_zeros_u32(unsigned w) BMNOEXCEPT
404{
405 BM_ASSERT(w);
406
407#if defined(BMAVX2OPT) || defined (BMAVX512OPT)
408 return (unsigned)_tzcnt_u32(w);
409#else
410 #if defined(BM_USE_GCC_BUILD) || (defined(__GNUG__) && (defined(__arm__) || defined(__aarch64__)))
411 return (unsigned) __builtin_ctz(w);
412 #else
413 return bm::bit_scan_forward32(w);
414 #endif
415#endif
416}
417
418
419/// 64-bit bit-scan fwd
420inline
421unsigned count_trailing_zeros_u64(bm::id64_t w) BMNOEXCEPT
422{
423 BM_ASSERT(w);
424
425#if defined(BMAVX2OPT) || defined (BMAVX512OPT)
426 return (unsigned)_tzcnt_u64(w);
427#else
428 #if defined(BM_USE_GCC_BUILD) || (defined(__GNUG__) && (defined(__arm__) || defined(__aarch64__)))
429 return (unsigned) __builtin_ctzll(w);
430 #else
431 unsigned z;
432 unsigned w1 = unsigned(w);
433 if (!w1)
434 {
435 z = 32;
436 w1 = unsigned(w >> 32);
437 z += bm::bit_scan_forward32(w1);
438 }
439 else
440 {
441 z = bm::bit_scan_forward32(w1);
442 }
443 return z;
444 #endif
445#endif
446}
447
448
449
450/*!
451 Returns BSR value
452 @ingroup bitfunc
453*/
454template <class T>
455unsigned bit_scan_reverse(T value) BMNOEXCEPT
456{
457 BM_ASSERT(value);
458
459 if (bm::conditional<sizeof(T)==8>::test())
460 {
461 #if defined(BM_USE_GCC_BUILD) || (defined(__GNUG__) && (defined(__arm__) || defined(__aarch64__)))
462 return (unsigned) (63 - __builtin_clzll(value));
463 #else
464 bm::id64_t v8 = value;
465 v8 >>= 32;
466 unsigned v = (unsigned)v8;
467 if (v)
468 {
469 v = bm::bit_scan_reverse32(v);
470 return v + 32;
471 }
472 #endif
473 }
474 return bm::bit_scan_reverse32((unsigned)value);
475}
476
477/*! \brief and functor
478 \internal
479 */
480struct and_func
481{
482 static
483 BMFORCEINLINE unsigned op(unsigned v1, unsigned v2) BMNOEXCEPT2
484 { return v1 & v2; }
485};
486/*! \brief xor functor
487 \internal
488 */
489struct xor_func
490{
491 static
492 BMFORCEINLINE unsigned op(unsigned v1, unsigned v2) BMNOEXCEPT2
493 { return v1 ^ v2; }
494};
495/*! \brief or functor
496 \internal
497 */
498struct or_func
499{
500 static
501 BMFORCEINLINE unsigned op(unsigned v1, unsigned v2) BMNOEXCEPT2
502 { return v1 | v2; }
503};
504/*! \brief sub functor
505 \internal
506 */
507struct sub_func
508{
509 static
510 BMFORCEINLINE unsigned op(unsigned v1, unsigned v2) BMNOEXCEPT2
511 { return v1 & ~~v2; }
512};
513
514BMFORCEINLINE
515unsigned mask_r_u32(unsigned nbit) BMNOEXCEPT
516{
517 BM_ASSERT(nbit < 32);
518 unsigned m = (~0u << nbit);
519 BM_ASSERT(m == block_set_table<true>::_right[nbit]);
520 return m;
521}
522
523BMFORCEINLINE
524unsigned mask_l_u32(unsigned nbit) BMNOEXCEPT
525{
526 BM_ASSERT(nbit < 32);
527 unsigned m = ~0u >> (31 - nbit);
528 BM_ASSERT(m == block_set_table<true>::_left[nbit]);
529 return m;
530}
531
532/// XOR swap two variables
533///
534/// @internal
535template<typename W>
536BMFORCEINLINE void xor_swap(W& x, W& y) BMNOEXCEPT
537{
538 BM_ASSERT(&x != &y);
539 x ^= y; y ^= x; x ^= y;
540}

545#endif

549
550/**
551 Сompute mask of bytes presense in 64-bit word
552
553 @param w - [in] input 64-bit word
554 @return mask with 8 bits
555 @internal
556 */
557inline
558unsigned compute_h64_mask(unsigned long long w)
559{
560 unsigned h_mask = 0;
561 for (unsigned i = 0; w && (i < 8); ++i, w >>= 8)
562 {
563 if ((unsigned char) w)
564 h_mask |= (1u<<i);
565 } // for
566 return h_mask;
567}
568
569
570/*!
571 Returns bit count
572 @ingroup bitfunc
573*/
574BMFORCEINLINE
575bm::id_t word_bitcount(bm::id_t w) BMNOEXCEPT
576{
577#if defined(BMSSE42OPT) || defined(BMAVX2OPT) || defined(BMAVX512OPT)
578 return bm::id_t(_mm_popcnt_u32(w));
579#else
580 #if defined(BM_USE_GCC_BUILD)
581 return (bm::id_t)__builtin_popcount(w);
582 #else
583 return
584 bm::bit_count_table<true>::_count[(unsigned char)(w)] +
585 bm::bit_count_table<true>::_count[(unsigned char)((w) >> 8)] +
586 bm::bit_count_table<true>::_count[(unsigned char)((w) >> 16)] +
587 bm::bit_count_table<true>::_count[(unsigned char)((w) >> 24)];
588 #endif
589#endif
590}
591
592
593/*!
594 Function calculates number of 1 bits in 64-bit word.
595 @ingroup bitfunc
596*/
597BMFORCEINLINE
598unsigned word_bitcount64(bm::id64_t x) BMNOEXCEPT
599{
600#if defined(BMSSE42OPT) || defined(BMAVX2OPT) || defined(BMAVX512OPT)
601 #if defined(BM64_SSE4) || defined(BM64_AVX2) || defined(BM64_AVX512)
602 return unsigned(_mm_popcnt_u64(x));
603 #else // 32-bit
604 return _mm_popcnt_u32(x >> 32) + _mm_popcnt_u32((unsigned)x);
605 #endif
606#else
607 #if defined(BM_USE_GCC_BUILD) || defined(__arm64__)
608 return (unsigned)__builtin_popcountll(x);
609 #else
610 #if (defined(__arm__)) // 32-bit
611 return bm::word_bitcount(x >> 32) + bm::word_bitcount((unsigned)x);
612 #else
613 x = x - ((x >> 1) & 0x5555555555555555);
614 x = (x & 0x3333333333333333) + ((x >> 2) & 0x3333333333333333);
615 x = (x + (x >> 4)) & 0x0F0F0F0F0F0F0F0F;
616 x = x + (x >> 8);
617 x = x + (x >> 16);
618 x = x + (x >> 32);
619 return x & 0xFF;
620 #endif
621 #endif
622#endif
623}
